intro: Hieracium lortetiae, commonly known as the Lortet's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves, which help it thrive in rocky or dry environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a single head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
